info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:39PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL WASHINGTON... CENTRAL GREENE AND WEST CENTRAL FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 239 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waynesburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesburg, Fredericktown-Millsboro, Fairdale, Jefferson Boro, Isabella, Rogersville, Deemston, Bobtown, Republic, Nemacolin, Marianna, Carmichaels, Rices Landing, Clarksville, Centerville, Nineveh, and Amity. This includes Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 6 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
